title.value: CommonAccent: Exploring Large Acoustic Pretrained Models for Accent Classification Based on Common Voice
title.quote: CommonAccent: Exploring Large Acoustic Pretrained Models for Accent Classification Based on Common Voice

description: The paper addresses the problem of recognizing accented speech in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems. It explores multilingual accent classification using the ECAPA-TDNN and Wav2Vec 2.0/XLSR architectures and introduces a benchmark dataset named CommonAccent. Fine-tuned models and the SpeechBrain toolkit recipe for accent classification are open-sourced, achieving state-of-the-art results in English accent classification.

research_field.quote: Despite the recent advancements in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), the recognition of accented speech still remains a dominant problem.

sub_research_field.quote: We address multilingual accent classification through the ECAPA-TDNN and Wav2Vec 2.0/XLSR architectures

We address multilingual accent classification through the ECAPA-TDNN and Wav2Vec 2.0/XLSR architectures
Our recipe utilizes data from Common Voice [10] dataset in four different languages, namely: English, German, Spanish, and Italian.
We introduce CommonAccent, a subset of Common Voice compiled as a benchmark dataset optimized for accent classification in multiple languages
We introduce a simple-to-follow recipe aligned to the SpeechBrain toolkit for accent classification
